intro: Tetratheca viminea var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sandplains and rocky areas. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a compact, bushy habit. The flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
